If you post copywritten material to X, it will be quickly taken down because it violates the DMCA.

We need to pass the TAKE IT DOWN Act to ensure everyone is protected online.

text:
It’s no secret that big tech companies Google and Meta have left wing political agendas.

But it’s clear they are actively programming their AI software with a political bias that goes so far as to suppresses the fact that there was an assassination attempt against President Trump.

That’s a new low, even for big tech, and it’s absolutely disgusting.

They’re not just suppressing this information out of personal hatred for President Trump, they’re doing it to interfere with the outcome of the 2024 presidential election.

I’m glad 
@GOPoversight
 is investigating this important issue ahead of the November election!

text:
Film, TV, and music all depend on human creativity and imagination.

AI could benefit artists — or cripple them. Already, 11% of ChatGPT's training data comes from arts and entertainment without most artists’ approval. 

Copyright law must protect all artists.

text:
I had very productive meetings with Finnish Prime Minister 
@PetteriOrpo
, Defense Minister 
@anttihakkanen
, and President 
@alexstubb
 regarding Finland’s role in NATO and future collaborations that will be mutually beneficial to both of our nations.

President Stubb is also a Furman University graduate who played on the golf team. What more could you want in an ally?

As one of the newest members of NATO, Finland brings a lot to the table. Finland is one of the most forward-leaning countries on AI and quantum computing research and development, and they have some of the largest shipyards in the world. The future of our economy and warfare itself will be determined by AI development, and Finland is way ahead of the game. There is no doubt their membership to NATO further strengthens the alliance.

The United States and our NATO allies need to build bigger naval forces to provide the deterrence that has been lost throughout the world, and in collaboration with Finland, we will greatly accelerate that endeavor.

We are truly lucky to have Finland as a new NATO member, and I look forward to this relationship growing.

We are truly lucky to have Finland as a new NATO member, and I look forward to this relationship growing.

text:
In just 6 days I will be hosting our 6th Annual Healthcare Innovation Summit in The Woodlands.

This event will bring together top healthcare professionals, forward-thinking innovators, and industry leaders to tackle the latest breakthroughs in medicine. If you’re in the healthcare field—or just want to get ahead of the curve—this is a great chance to engage with the experts driving change and shaping the future of healthcare. The formal program starts at 4:30 PM, with discussions from some of the brightest minds in healthcare on critical topics like:

– Customized Medicine for Curing Diseases
– Revamping Healthcare Payment Systems
– Innovative Devices to Keep Patients Out of Hospitals
– Brain Stimulation Devices for PTSD and Depression
– Revolutionizing Cancer Treatment with Tiny Implantable Devices
– Harnessing AI to Streamline Drug Approval

Head to the link in my bio to register.

text:
In the fourth episode of The Hill & Valley Podcast by 
@jacobhelberg
, Delian Asparouhov (
@zebulgar
), Partner at Founders Fund and Co-Founder at Varda Space, brings together Impulse Space Founder Tom Mueller (
@lrocket
) and Congressman 
@KenCalvert
 to discuss the urgency of why the U.S. is diving into the second space race.

--

TIMESTAMPS:
(00:00) Lunar Ambitions
(00:37) The new space race
(01:49) Identifying key players in the space race and the role of China
(02:48) The future of space: propulsion, AI, and the economy
(05:38) Government and commercial sector collaboration in space
(07:07) Addressing threats: Russia's space ambitions and global security
(09:23) The Importance of space for military and civilian life
(10:24) Boosting U.S. space capabilities
(15:16) The Moon: the ultimate high ground in space
(22:22) Collaboration and competition: shaping the future of space
(26:31) Regulatory challenges and the future of space exploration

text:
Customs at #Detroit Metro Airport is now using facial recognition tech in a voluntary process called “Simplified Arrival”. I’ve yet to see evidence that this tech keeps us safe, instead I’ve heard from experts and residents who have well-founded concerns.

text:
This week, Kendrick Castillo expected to finish high school. He was on the robotics team and planned on studying engineering in college.

Instead, he died a hero, charging a shooter to save his classmates. We must remember Kendrick, and refuse to let these tragedies become normal
